name: Southern Ground Hornbill
description: It has black feathers with red bare patches and wattled skin on its head. Females have blue-violet throat coloration. White wingtips are visible in flight.
image_alt: Southern Ground Hornbill, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 60–65 cm, tail length 29.5–36 cm, wing length 52.5–61 cm, weight 3.1–5.6 kg
attractions: Hornbill family members are robust birds with large beaks, often adorned with horn-like casques. They primarily live on the ground in small groups.
breeding: We kept a pair from 1954–1957. Breeding resumed in 1984 and continues, with the first chick raised in 1994.
